title: Contextualized Practical Learning Program for Agricultural Extension Agents: Strengthening Capabilities Through Socio-Historical Frameworks

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, along with basic understanding of local community systems and agricultural economic structures
context.additional_context: Learners demand practical knowledge applicable to agricultural settings, with an emphasis on smartphone-enabled blended collaboration. Key learning contexts include comparative analysis of regional agricultural cultures and community cooperation case studies

learning_goals: Learners can analyze economic and environmental issues in agricultural settings through experiential learning models and propose solutions based on sustainable agricultural policies and community development strategies.

Learners can share and integrate three or more agricultural techniques and two or more field know-hows in a community of practice (workshops, field training, etc.), complete a team project report or presentation considering local cultural and institutional contexts, and achieve performance meeting at least four out of five peer evaluation rubric items (80% or higher).
Learners can distinguish between formal and informal knowledge sources and develop strategies to integrate them according to the historical and geographical characteristics of the local community.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
